contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: someone lifted a lead covering off the basket" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a lead covering was lifted off the basket

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will set the basket there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the basket will be set there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will give the crown" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "the people will safely sow seed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: seeds of peace will be sown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and enemies will burn the city to the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so she will be devoured by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The majestic cedar trees are no more" or "The cedar trees were once majestic, but now they are ruined" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: What was majestic has been devastated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one punishes them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])

This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the sheep that are perishing—let them perish" or "the sheep that are to wander and get lost—let them get lost" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sheep that are being destroyed—let them be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the covenant ended" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your enemies will capture the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Enemies will plunder the houses and rape the women" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The houses will be plundered and the women raped

contextId.occurrenceNote: Not removing people from the city is spoken of as if the people will not be "cut off." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your enemies will allow the remaining people to stay in the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the remainder of the people will not be cut off from the city

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The presences of Yahweh will split the Mount of Olives ... causing there to be a very great valley" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The Mount of Olives will be split ... by a very great valley

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "only Yahweh knows when that day will begin" or "only Yahweh knows when that time will begin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a day known only to Yahweh
